datagenerator.util
Class QueryGenerator

java.lang.Object
  datagenerator.util.QueryGenerator

public class QueryGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

This class has several static methods for dynamically generating SQL queries used by various parts of the program to interact with the database.

Author:
Patrick McMorran

getStateQuery

public static java.lang.String getStateQuery(java.lang.String[] States)
This method returns a string containing a query to retrieve data on specified states.

Parameters:
States - This is an array of strings containing each state that should be called.
Returns:
This String contains the query to get location data specific to the defined states

getPopulation

public static java.lang.String getPopulation(java.lang.String Zip)
This method returns a query that returns the population of a given zipcode.

Parameters:
Zip - This is a String containing a 5 digit zipcode.
Returns:
This String contains the SQL Query Generated.

getZipStreets

public static java.lang.String getZipStreets(java.lang.String Zip)

Parameters:
Zip - This String contains the 5 digit zipcode used for the query.
Returns:
This String contains the SQL Query Generated.

getPrefix

public static java.lang.String getPrefix(java.lang.String Zipcode,
                                         java.lang.String Areacode)
This method returns an SQL query that retrieves all of the phone prefixes within a given Zipcode and Areacode.

Parameters:
Zipcode - This is a String that contains the Zipcode for the Query.
Areacode - This is a String that contains the Areacode for the Query.
Returns:
This String contains the SQL Query.

getLocationIndexQuery

public static java.lang.String getLocationIndexQuery(boolean[] settings,
                                                     java.lang.String Table_name)
This generates a query that is used to build an index on the unique data table used to keep track of previously generated location data.

Parameters:
settings - This is used to configure the query to only track data that the generator is configured to produce.
Table_name - This String is the name of the Field's unique table.
Returns:
This String contains the query generated.

getNameIndexQuery

public static java.lang.String getNameIndexQuery(boolean[] settings,
                                                 java.lang.String Table_name)
This generates a query that is used to build an index on the unique data table used to keep track of previously generated name data.

Parameters:
settings - This is used to configure the query to only track data that the generator is configured to produce.
Table_name - This String is the name of the Field's unique table.
Returns:
This String contains the query generated.

getUniqueLocationQuery

public static java.lang.String getUniqueLocationQuery(boolean[] settings,
                                                      java.lang.String Table_name,
                                                      java.lang.String[] tuple)
This method generates a query that is used to verify that a location entry has not already been generated.

Parameters:
settings - This is a boolean array that defines what data the generator is generating.
Table_name - This is a String containing the name of the Field's Unique table.
tuple - This array of Strings contains the randomly generated data that the generator needs to ensure it hasn't been previously generated.
Returns:
This String contains the SQL Query.

getCharStringUniqueQuery

public static java.lang.String getCharStringUniqueQuery(java.lang.String CharString,
                                                        java.lang.String TableName)
This method returns a string containing a query that checks the if the supplied character string is unique.

Parameters:
CharString - This is the character String that was randomly generated.
TableName - This is the name of the table that the CharStringField uses to track generated queries.
Returns:
This String Contains the Query.

getCustomUniqueQuery

public static java.lang.String getCustomUniqueQuery(java.lang.String CharString,
                                                    java.lang.String TableName)
This method returns a string containing a query that checks the if the supplied String is unique.

Parameters:
CharString - This is the character String that was randomly selected.
TableName - This is the name of the table that the CharStringField uses to track generated queries.
Returns:
This String Contains the Query.

getUniqueNameQuery

public static java.lang.String getUniqueNameQuery(boolean[] settings,
                                                  java.lang.String Table_name,
                                                  java.lang.String[] tuple)
This method generates a query that is used to verify that a name entry has not already been generated.

Parameters:
settings - This is a boolean array that defines what data the generator is generating.
Table_name - This is a String containing the name of the Field's Unique table.
tuple - This array of Strings contains the randomly generated data that the generator needs to ensure it hasn't been previously generated.
Returns:
This String contains the SQL Query.
